articles.description: Listen to BBC Radio 5 Live and follow live text updates as Chelsea face Ajax in the Women's Champions League quarter-final second leg at Stamford Bridge.
articles.title: Women's Champions League: Chelsea host Ajax in quarter-final second leg

articles.description: Sunrisers Hyderabad smash 277-3 - the highest total in Indian Premier League history - in a 31-run victory against Mumbai Indians.
articles.title: Sunrisers hit highest total in IPL history

articles.description: The Enhanced Games has been derided as "a clown show" and "borderline criminal". But their founder and his backers believe in a future few have foreseen.
articles.title: The mind behind the 'doped Olympics'

articles.description: Do you agree with our pundits on who starts for England at Euro 2024? Have your say here.
articles.title: Who starts England's Euro opener - do you agree with our pundits?

articles.description: Spain's ex-football boss could go to prison because of a non-consensual kiss at the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Luis Rubiales: Prosecutors want jail for World Cup kiss

articles.description: World number one and 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic says he and coach Goran Ivanisevic parted ways "a few days ago".
articles.title: Novak Djokovic splits with coach Goran Ivanisevic

articles.description: We asked for your views on Scotland's 1-0 home defeat by Northern Ireland and the tenor of the responses was unsurprisingly negative.
articles.title: Has 'dire' Scotland loss dented fans' optimism?

articles.description: Manchester City defender and former England captain Steph Houghton will retire at the end of the current Women's Super League season.
articles.title: Former England captain Houghton to retire

articles.description: Wout van Aert will miss the rest of the classics season after breaking his collarbone and several ribs in a crash at Dwars door Vlaanderen.
articles.title: Wout van Aert: Team Visma star to miss Tour of Flanders and Paris-Roubaix through injury

articles.description: Crystal Palace goalkeeper Sam Johnstone has been ruled out for the rest of the season and is set to miss Euro 2024 following elbow surgery.
articles.title: Johnstone set to miss Euros after elbow surgery
